column1: #Text=Here, these values of the inner products each have an aspect that the value indicates a distance along the swing direction (dotted lines L11 to L15 in FIG. 25).

#Text=Thus, when the waiting threshold value is set to be "-1", the waiting threshold value corresponds to the dotted line L14 which is distant from an origin by 1.0 in a direction opposite to the swinging direction as shown in FIG. 26 (which is a line in which an inner product becomes "-1", corresponds to the straight line 102 in FIG. 14 and the like, and is perpendicular to the swinging direction).

#Text=Thus, by comparing the above values of the inner products with the waiting threshold value, "-1", a determination can be made as to whether a point indicating difference acceleration is located on an inner side (a side close to the origin, the point P21 in FIG. 26) or an outer side (a side distant from the origin, the points P22 and P23 in FIG. 26) of the dotted line 14.

#Text=Consequently, in the present embodiment, by determining whether or not the inner product has shifted from the outer side of the waiting threshold value, "-1", to the inner side thereof, the determination is made as to whether or not the inner product has shifted across the dotted line L14 (corresponding to the waiting threshold value).
#Text=It is noted that a different swinging direction causes a different position and a different inclination of a dotted line corresponding to the waiting threshold value.
#Text=As an example, FIG. 27 shows inner products and a waiting threshold value in a case where the swinging direction is the obliquely downward right direction at an angle of 45 degrees.
#Text=[0152] FIG. 28 is a flow chart showing in detail the reverse acceleration recognition processing shown at the step S4.
#Text=As shown in FIG. 28, the CPU 10 sets "0" at the timer 135 (a step S61).
#Text=Then, the CPU 10 adds "1" to the timer 135 (a step S62).
#Text=[0153] Next, the CPU 10 executes the difference acceleration calculation processing (a step S63).
#Text=This processing is the same as the above processing at the step S23, and hence the description thereof will be omitted.
#Text=[0154] Next, the CPU 10 calculates an inner product between difference acceleration calculated at the step S63 and the vector indicated by the swinging direction vector 134 (a step S64).
#Text=[0155] Next, the CPU 10 determines whether or not the calculated inner product is larger than the value of the waiting threshold value data 131 (a step S65).

#Text=In the present embodiment, since the value of "-1" is set in advance as a value of the waiting threshold value data 131, for example, in FIG. 26, if the inner product is "-1", it can be determined that the acceleration has not shifted across the dotted line L14.
#Text=If the inner product is smaller than "-1", it can be determined that the acceleration has shifted across the dotted line L14.
